page.title: 08ASHGROVE TEAROOM
page.content: Next to the Ashgrove Filling Station stands a licensed self-service cafe. Many of its customers are regulars who enjoy eating a meal in a rural setting. One regular literally drops in, by helicopter, once a fortnight. This caused quite a sensation at first but is now treated as normal. No special facilities are provided for disabled people, but the doors are wide enough to take a wheelchair. A busload of disabled calls regularly and have no problems. The dishes served are all home cooked and home-made scones and cakes are served with afternoon tea. It is usually with an evening meal that customers avail themselves of the opportunity of having a drink.
